title: 107_hr3007
content:
The Act may be cited as the "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" and provides small business assistance. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" amends the Small Business Act to provide grants and loans to general aviation small businesses affected by Federal ground stop orders following the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" offers loans to general aviation small businesses impacted by the economic fallout from the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks, with no interest accruing on the loan. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" provides loans to general aviation small businesses affected by the aftermath of the September 11, 2001 attacks, with no interest accruing for the first year. After the initial year, the loan terms are the same as economic injury loans. The grant or loan is additional to any other assistance under the Act, without limits, and no disaster declaration is needed for eligibility. The "General Aviation Small Business Relief Act of 2001" defines a general aviation small business concern as one that provides aviation services like aircraft rentals and flight training. It also defines substantial economic injury as harm that prevents a small business from meeting its obligations, paying expenses, or conducting normal business activities. Amendments are made to the Small Business Act to reflect these definitions. Amendments are made to the Small Business Act regarding the definition of a general aviation small business concern and substantial economic injury. Appropriations are authorized to the Small Business Administration for the implementation of these changes. SEC. 3. DEFERMENT OF SMALL BUSINESS LOAN PAYMENTS. Payments on small business loans from the Small Business Administration will be deferred for 1 year with no interest accruing. After the deferral period, regular payments will resume. The term "general aviation small business concern" is defined in this section.

SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF DUE DATE FOR EXCISE TAX DEPOSITS. Extension of due date for excise tax deposits for general aviation small business concerns under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Timely deposits required between September 10, 2001, and November 15, 2001, can be made by January 15, 2002, if prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury. "Airline-related deposit" refers to taxes imposed on air transportation.
